Q2 Natural Gas Effective Price for Enbridge, Union and EPCOR (½/m3)
Source: Ontario Energy Board, Natural Gas Rates - Historical
Note: Rates for all three utilities are presented as a combined price that includes costs for commodity, storage, and transportation. The storage price component for Enbridge is estimated.

On August 3, 2017, the OEB released its decision approving the application by Natural Resource Gas Limited (NRG) to transfer its natural gas distribution system assets and OEB regulatory approvals to EPCOR. On November 1, 2017, the transaction was completed.

column5:
Henry Hub - NYMEX (US) converted to
US$/Mmbtu

column1: Source: Deloitte Price forecast - Resource Evaluation & Advisory - June 30, 2019.

Note: All prices are in current dollars. Raw data from Deloitte has been converted to CDN$/GJ for all forecasts using the TransCanada conversion tool (http://www.tccustomerexpress.com/conversiontool/), and the US EIA  ("$ per Mcf divided by 1.036 equals $ per MMBtu" https://www.eia.gov/tools/faqs/faq.php?id=45&t=8). For US$ to CDN $, Royal Bank of Canada Economics Research - Financial Markets Daily (July 12, 2019), One and Two year forward exchange rates were used.
One year Forward exchange rate for US$ to C$ applied to 2020 = $0.7692 / 1.2991
Two year Forward exchange rate for US$ to C$ applied to 2021 = $0.7701 / 1.2985
